content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #121

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Include scenario’s that are not dependent on security models.

Submitted by Ricardo Quintano Neira on behalf of @bvdh
Chapter/section: Session Discovery
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Enhancement

Summary: Include scenario’s that are not dependent on security models.

Comment: We should also include scenario’s that are not dependent on security models.

Existing wording: The app MUST either be launched from the driving application following the SMART on FHIR EHR launch flow or the app may initiate the launch following the SMART on FHIR standalone launch

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

isaacvetter commented on Issue #121

Hey @bvdh, we're struggling with this. How to describe the exchange of the hub.topic when the type of launch mechanisms commonly used are not really appropriate to standardize?

Can you help?

bvdh commented on Issue #121

This one is related to #125. I suggest that we take the approach mentioned in my comment in #125 and consider a proposal for an OAuth less proposal when it is made in time for this release.

isaacvetter commented on Issue #121:

Proposed resolution: Persuasive
Proposed resolution comment: We will clarify that SMART on FHIR support is a SHOULD, not a SHALL, but that guidance on the exchange of the hub.topic (and hub.url) is currently not defined in this specification. Further, we will consider a proposal for an OAuth-less launch description if it is made in time for this release and has implementer support and feedback.

Meeting notes: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/IMIN/Teleconferences

Resolved in #125.
